pr_title: HDDS-4115. CLI command to show current SCM leader and follower status.

timeline.bodyText: One thing I am not sure is what should be fetched from Ratis peers. Should I also include which one is leader and which one is follower?
timeline.author: amaliujia

replies.bodyText: I can see this method be wrapper in ScmHAManager to show a list of scm hosts.
replies.author: timmylicheng

replies.bodyText: Got it. Will move this functionality to ScmHAManager.
replies.author: amaliujia

timeline.bodyText: Does this API belongs to StorageContainerLocationProtocol?
timeline.author: amaliujia

replies.bodyText: Any way to merge it with GetSCMInfo?
replies.author: timmylicheng

replies.bodyText: Pushed a new commit to merge this logic into GetScmInfo
replies.author: amaliujia

timeline.bodyText: This is actually not a unit test as it does not check what is returned. I will think about whether there is a simple way to test that API directly.
timeline.author: amaliujia

timeline.bodyText: Name seems a bit verbose. Let me find a syntax to align with OM HA
timeline.author: timmylicheng

replies.bodyText: I think both this one and OM HA getserviceroles can be improved.
replies.author: adoroszlai

replies.bodyText:
@adoroszlai
What kind of improvement OM HA getserviceroles you are thinking of? I am happy to make a separate PR for that.
replies.author: amaliujia

replies.bodyText:
status or roles would probably be enough to indicate the goal of the subcommand, something like
ozone admin (om|scm) status
replies.author: adoroszlai

replies.bodyText: Thanks. I will adopt ozone admin scm status in this PR and I will send another PR for ozone admin om status
replies.author: amaliujia

replies.bodyText:
ozone admin om getserviceroles -id=<>
This is what OM does. I have my +1 on ozone admin (om|scm) roles. Status is more like health check.
replies.author: timmylicheng

replies.bodyText:
I am ok with both.
@adoroszlai  what do you think?
replies.author: amaliujia

replies.bodyText: I think it depends on whether you want to keep this command specific to roles, or may extend the same command in the future with other status info.  Probably "roles" is better now, and "status" can be either a separate command or another alias later.
replies.author: adoroszlai

replies.bodyText:
that makes sense. Indeed status sounds more like a health check and can carry much more information.
Consider OM is also actually getting, essentially, roles. We can start from roles
replies.author: amaliujia

timeline.bodyText:
Apart from UT, we can have an acceptance test to test CLI.
You may find examples here: #375
timeline.author: timmylicheng

timeline.message: HDDS-4115. CLI command to show current SCM leader and follower status.
fixup! 1. use `ozone admin scm roles` 2. fix acceptance test

timeline.bodyText: We probably want to align the naming here. Either we use roles or status for all external and internal interfaces.
timeline.author: timmylicheng
timeline.diffHunk:

+package org.apache.hadoop.ozone.admin.scm;
+
+import java.util.List;
+import java.util.concurrent.Callable;
+import org.apache.hadoop.hdds.cli.HddsVersionProvider;
+import org.apache.hadoop.hdds.scm.client.ScmClient;
+import picocli.CommandLine;
+
+/**
+ * Handler of scm status command.
+ */
+@CommandLine.Command(
+    name = "roles",
+    description = "List all SCMs and their respective Ratis server status",
+    mixinStandardHelpOptions = true,
+    versionProvider = HddsVersionProvider.class)
+public class GetScmRatisStatusSubcommand implements Callable<Void> {
+
+  @CommandLine.ParentCommand
+  private ScmAdmin parent;
+
+  @Override
+  public Void call() throws Exception {
+    ScmClient scmClient = parent.createScmClient();
+    List<String> status = scmClient.getScmRatisStatus();

replies.bodyText: Good point. I have switched all status to roles
replies.author: amaliujia

timeline.author: timmylicheng

replies.bodyText: Actually I meant OM. It turns out that I cannot ignore omServiceId to start the cluster (there is a check for this service id).
replies.author: amaliujia

timeline.bodyText: You can use the default SCM RatisServer port. Check ratisBindPort in SCMHAConfiguration
timeline.author: timmylicheng

replies.bodyText: Switched to use the default port. In the future I will think about how to better construct MockSCMHAManager for testing purpose (as the code is evolving we can keep updating MockSCMHAManager)
replies.author: amaliujia
